B.</ls>; नाभ्यासक्रममीक्षते <ls>Pt. 1. 151</ls>; <ls>Ms. 12. 74</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 323.</ls> {@--2@} Repeated practice or exercise, continued practice or use; अविरतश्रमाभ्यासात् <ls>K. 30</ls>, <ls>Pt. 1. 133</ls>; अभ्यासेन तु कौंतेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते <ls>Bg. 6. 35</ls>, <ls n="Bg. 6.">44</ls> by constant practice (to remain pure and unmodified); <ls n="Bg.">12. 12</ls>; योग° <ls>Y. 3. 51</ls> practice of concentration; hence sometimes used for ‘concentration of mind upon one subject’; °निगृहीतेन मनसा <ls>R. 10. 23</ls>; so शर°, अस्त्र° &c. {@--3@} Habit, custom, practice; मिथ्योपपदात् कृञोऽभ्यासे <ls>P. I. 3. 71</ls>; तद् यथाभ्यासं अभिधीयतां <ls>U. 1</ls> therefore address me as is your wont; अमंगलाभ्यासरतिं <ls>Ku. 5. 65</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 68.</ls> {@--4@} Discipline in arms, exercise, military discipline. {@--5@} Reciting, study, repeated reading or learning by heart; काव्यज्ञशिक्षयाभ्यासः <ls>K. P. 1</ls>; <ls>K. 146</ls>, <ls n="K.">200</ls>; <ls>Ms. 5. 4</ls>; वेद° is of {5} kinds: --वेदस्वीकरणं पूर्वं विचारोऽभ्यसनं जपः . तद्दानं चैव शिष्येभ्यो वेदाभ्यासो हि पंचधा .. <ls>Dakṣa.</ls> {@--6@} Vicinity, proximity, neighbourhood (for अभ्याश); चूतयष्टिरिवाभ्यासे (शे) मधौ परभृतोन्मुखी <ls>Ku. 6. 2</ls>; ( अभ्यासे-शे मधौ must mean here speaking to ‘Madhu who was {%near%} her,’ {%<ab>scil.</ab>%} by having manifested himself before her, which fully preserves the simile of Pārvatī, herself silent, speaking to her lover who was near her through her friend); अर्पितेयं तवाभ्यासे सीता पुण्यव्रता वधूः <ls>U. 7. 17</ls> given in your charge; <ls>Śi. 3. 40</ls>; अभ्यासा-शा-दागतः <ls>P. II. 1. 38</ls> <ls>Sk.</ls> (regarded as an Aluk compound). {@--7@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) Reduplication. {@--8@} The first syllable of a reduplicated base, reduplicative syllable; पूर्वोऽभ्यासः <ls>P. VI. 1. 4</ls>; अत्र ये द्वे विहिते तयोः पूर्वोऽभ्याससंज्ञः स्यात् <ls>Sk.</ls> {@--9@} (In <ab>Math.</ab>) Multiplication. {@--10@} (In poetry) Repetition of the last verses or lines (as of a chorus); chorus, burden of a song.
